intro: Cynanchum streptanthum, commonly known as the Indian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including India and China. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes other milkweeds known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or a perennial herb, characterized by its opposite leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. Its latex is toxic and can cause skin irritation, a common feature among milkweed species. Cynanchum streptanthum is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
